citation.article-title: Simplicispira limi sp. nov., isolated from activated sludge.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Simplicispira limi sp. nov.
Simplicispira limi (li′mi. L. gen. n. limi of sludge).
Cells form white, glistening, translucent, slightly sticky, raised circular colonies with lobate margins on R2A agar.
Growth occurs at 10–40 °C (optimum at 30 °C).
Cells are Gram-negative rods, 0.7–0.8 μm wide and 1.5–1.7 μm long (at 25 °C on R2A agar).
Motile by means of a polar flagellum.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Urea, Tween 80, tyrosine and aesculin are hydrolysed.
Casein, Tween 20, hypoxanthine, starch and gelatin are not hydrolysed.

Acids are produced from d-raffinose, d-lactose, d-fructose and d-mannitol, but not from myo-inositol, l-arabinose, d-glucose, sorbitol, sucrose, rhamnose, amygdalin, melibiose, d-galactose, d-mannose, arbutin or salicin.

Produces alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, but not α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase or α-fucosidase.
Weak enzymic activity is observed for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, β-galactosidase and α-glucosidase.

Utilizes Tweens 40 and 80, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid monomethyl ester, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, dl-lactic acid, succinamic acid, l-proline and 2,3-butanediol (Biolog GN2).
Other organic substrates included in Biolog GN2 microplates are not utilized.
Contains a large amount of phosphatidylethanolamine and a small amount of diphosphatidylglycerol as polar lipids.
The major isoprenoid quinone is ubiquinone-8 (Q-8).
The major fatty acids are summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH), C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω7c and C18 : 1ω7c 11-methyl.
The DNA G+C content is 63.3 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, EMB325T (=KCTC 12608T=DSM 17964T), was isolated from sludge performing EBPR in a laboratory-scale SBR.
